# .ini Files [(by Robophill)](https://www.twitch.tv/robophill) 

## Description

Allows Streamer.bot to read and write to .ini files.

## Installation

To install the actions, copy the following code and paste into your `Import Actions` pane:

```text

```

![INI_File_Import.png](/extensions/ini-files/images/INI_File_Import.png)

## Usage

>(Disclaimer: This was made using Streamer.bot v0.1.4, should still work with updated versions)
{.is-warning}

The INI - Get Action
![INI_File_Get_Action.png](/extensions/ini-files/images/INI_File_Get_Action.png)

and INI - Set Action
![INI_File_Set_Action.png](/extensions/ini-files/images/INI_File_Set_Action.png)

are both example actions to help demonstrate and let you experiment with how INIFile - Get Data, and INIFile - Set Data are used.


There are four global variables that are used for the following purposes:

```text
"INIPath" - This will be the directory of your .ini file, e.g C:\Users\user\Desktop\Example.ini
"INISection" - This will be the Section name within the INI file
"INIKey" - This will be the Key name within the Section
"INIKeyContent" - This will be the Content within the Key
```

An example of how an ini file is structured is

![INI_File_Structure.png](/extensions/ini-files/images/INI_File_Structure.png)

So we have a Section named "Robophill", a Key named "Points", and the Content as "123".
If we wanted to Get this information we would set the global variables to

```text
INIPath = where your ini file is located
INISection = Robophill
INIKey = Points
```

Then use action INI - Get Data, and the global variable INIKeyContent will now have the value of 123.

If we wanted to Set information we would set the global variables the same way we did to Get the information, but now we also set INIKeyContent to what we want saved in the ini file.
So if we set INIKeyContent to 321, that would replace the 123 in the ini file.

This also works for words and/or symbols, it isn't limited to just numbers. However, I have set it up to detect if the Content only contains numbers so that it saves the global variable accordingly to be usable with other numbers. Such as calculations, incrementations, etc.
